revised_title: Early Development of Nerves in Chick Embryos
tldr: The author studied the early development of nerves in chick embryos, focusing on the cranial and spinal nerves. They discovered that the cells forming the nerves arise from the median dorsal ridge of the hind brain and the spinal cord. The cranial and spinal nerves are connected by a longitudinal commissure of spherical cells, and the nerves attach to the summit of the neural canal before shifting to their final positions.
